question: Okay. Okay. Okay. Take the garbage out. Every day, take the garbage out...Rick Rodin is on the mound for the Yankees! He looks into the catcher's mitt, shakes off the first signal, takes the turn, wipes the sweat off his brow, leans back and fires...
answer: Yeah! Good-bye Mr. Spaulding! ...Here, here! Quick!

question: Got it. Need it. Need it. Got it.
answer: Hey. Hey. Hey! You ever go by Simpson's desk when she's grading papers or somethin'? When she's leaned over, you can see right down her shirt.

question: No!
Bra?
answer: No. No. She's got one of those undershirt things. So if you get real close to the board, you can see all the way down to her flowers.

question: Woah!
Need it. Got it. Got it. Need it...
answer: Hey. Hey. Hey! Oh my God, it's Cynthia! How did a geek like Freddy Benson get a sister like that?

question: Hi!...He says hi!...Unbelievable! God! She likes you! I know she likes you! I'll find out, okay!
answer: Shimmy, shimmy cocoa pop! Shimmy, shimmy rock! Shimmy, shimmy cocoa pop! Shimmy, shimmy rock! I met a girlfriend a triscuit! She said, a triscuit a biscuit! Ice cream, soda pop, vanilla on the top! Ooh, Shelly's out, walking down the street, ten times a week! I read it! I said it! I stole my momma's credit! I'm cool! I'm hot! Sock me in the stomach three more times! Don't forget to call me after supper.

question: Okay.
Don't worry! I'm as interested as you are.
You're in!
answer: What do you mean, I'm in?

question: Cynthia Benson!
You ready for this? She doesn't like Barry anymore!
Yeah!
answer: Nah! Nah! I don't know about this one, Bob. No, this looks too scary.

question: Oh my gosh!
answer: See, I told you he doesn't want to go on it.

question: No! No! It's just that I...I want to go on it myself.
Yeah. I think it's something...yeah, I think it's something I should do. Half hour.
Oh, hi!
answer: Hi! Have you been on this before?

question: This?
Yes.
Yes.
Yes.
This is Josh Baskin. This is Darin. He drives.
answer: Next! Yo next! Yo next! Woah! Read this sign. You must be at least this big to ride this ride!

question: What?
answer: Hey, I don't make the rules here. Next! Next!

question: Well, it's a stupid rule.
answer: Look, why don't you try the kiddy ride?

question: Drop twenty-five cents here. C'mon! C'mon! C'mon! ...Neat! ...Make my wish....I wish I were big....Your wish is granted.
What?
answer: It's seven-thirty. Are you up? ...Come on Sleepy Head! You're going to miss the bus and I can't drive you today! ...What does he do in his sleep? ...Honey? I put out some clean clothes. Bring down your dungarees and stuff for the laundry, okay?

question: Okay.
answer: Are you getting a cold, Josh?

question: No! Fine!
answer: He's got a cold. Then Rachel's gonna get a cold and I'm gonna get a cold...

question: Oh my God.
Be right there!
answer: Josh! Hurry up! Your eggs are getting cold! ...Bring down Rachel with you, all right?

question: Okay!
answer: You want orange juice or...What about your breakfast?! Oh, you...don't! Don't!

question: I'm sorry! ...Mom, it's me. It's Josh. Mom, I'm a grown up!
I made a wish last night...I turned into a grown up, Mom! I made this wish on a machine...
...and it turned me into a grown up! It was last night at the carnival! My birthday is November 3rd...I got a B on my history test!
answer: Here's my purse! You can have anything that's in it! Go away!

question: My, my, my baseball team is called the Dukes! Uh, I made this for you! Who are you calling? Ah! I have a birthmark behind my left knee!
answer: You bastard! What did you do to my son?

question: I am your son, Mom!
answer: Where is my child?! Where is my son?! Police!

question: I'm open! Here! I'm open!
Yeah? What?
Coach Burns! Coach Burns! Coach Burns!
answer: Wait a minute! Shut up! Shut up! I'm your best friend, you've gotta believe me! I'll prove it to you! Billy, please!

question: Help! Help!
answer: God damn it Billy Kopecky! Look, I know that I don't look like myself, okay! But something really strange happened and I'm really scared and I need your help! You're my best friend! I can prove it to you! ...Ooh! The spades go, Down! Down! Baby! Down! Down the roller coaster! Sweet, sweet baby! Sweet, sweet delectable! Shimmy, shimmy cocoa pop! Shimmy, shimmy rock! Shimmy, shimmy cocoa pop! Shimmy, shimmy rock! I met a girlfriend a triscuit! She said a triscuit a biscuit! Ice cream, soda pop, vanilla on the top! Ooh Shelly, walking down the street, ten times a week! I met it! I said it! I stole my mother's credit! I'm cool! I'm hot! Sock me in the stomach three more times!

question: Josh? You look terrible.
We go to the city, we lay low for a couple of days, find that Zoltar Machine, make your wish...you'll be home by Thursday!
answer: Well, I'm not supposed to go to New York without my folks!

question: C'mon! You'll be fine! ...Here.
From my Dad's top drawer!
It's his emergency fund!
No, not really.
No it doesn't.
answer: Saint James, Josh, it's religious. Hi.

question: I don't want to stay here by myself.
answer: I can't help it Josh. I've gotta be home by ten. Look, I'll cut classes tomorrow and we'll find that Zoltar thing before you know it, okay? It's just one night. All right?

question: All right.
What if I can't sleep?
answer: It's probably better if you don't. See you in the morning.

question: Well, you mean like what time?
answer: 8:30. I'd use the chain if I were you.

question: Mom...Mom.... I told you, it's not a video game.
Well, it's not a video game.
answer: This one's got a number on it. Does yours?

question: No. Oh wait, here's one.
answer: Hey, what are doing? What are doing?

question: Do you have Zoltar?
answer: No. I told you, I looked back in the back. I've got Powerhouse, I've got ...

question: We really need Zoltar.
I'm gonna be thirty years old for the rest of my life.
answer: Would you come on. We'll figure something out. By the way, you may be older than that!

question: So now what?
answer: I'll come and see you everyday after school.

question: How?
answer: I'll tell them I made the basketball team.

question: I won't have anything to do.
I can't get a job.
answer: Why? It can't be any different than school. What are you good at?

question: I don't know. Making spit balls?
I don't know how drive.
answer: Oh yeah, right...Cardiological technician, civil engineer...

question: You gonna eat your cherry?
Billy?
Hey, go on to the next column.
answer: Collection agent, company clerk, computer operator, construction engineer...

question: Computer operator? Computer operator, read that one.
answer: Josh, would you quit with your stupid computers!

question: Just read it!
Okay, what's next? There.
Your paper route.
Paper route circulation?
What's he got? Hey, don't worry about it.
answer: Social Security number? What is that?

question: My locker combination.
Great!
Yes. Yes.
answer: The Personnel Director will see you now....Uh, you son can wait out here.

question: Couple of numbers missing on your Social Security.
One two. Says here you've got four years experience.
All on computers?
Where did you go to school?
Oh, G.W. My brother-in-law got his doctorate there. Did you pledge?

It happened again! David, the girl is absolutely useless! You've got to get me someone who knows what she is doing! Excuse me. I'm not getting any of my mail, nothing has been filed! Ever since she got engaged, my life has been a disaster!
answer: You know, she came so highly recommended.

question: She spent the last three months writing down her married name. Mrs. Judy Hicks. Mrs. Donald Hicks. Mrs. Judy Mitchleson Hicks. Sometimes with a hyphen, sometimes without a hyphen. Sometimes she spells the hyphen!
answer: Well, I really don't know where I can put her.

question: Put her on unemployment!
When can you start?
I thought we'd start you out with preschoolers. Should take you a few days. Give you a chance to find your way around. Do you smoke?
Only on breaks in the coffee room....Most of that is pretty straight forward stuff. If you have any questions, come to me. Good luck.
Bye!
answer: Psst! Psst! Hey! Hey! I'm Scott Brennan.

question: Uh, I'm Josh Baskin.
answer: Listen, what are you trying to do? Get us all fired?

question: Huh?
answer: You've gotta slow down. Pace yourself. Slowly! Slowly!

question: Sorry. Today's my first day.
So how long have you worked here?
answer: Five years. Work stinks but the fringe benefits are great! See that girl over there in the red? Say hi to her and she'll be yours. She'll wrap her legs around you so tight you'll be begging for mercy!

question: Well, I'll stay away from her then!
answer: Excuse me. Yeah Brennan. I gave it to you yesterday! Oh, here it is. I don't have time to xerox it. Let the new guy do it.

question: I'm fine.
answer: You could kill somebody running around here like that!

question: It's all right Paul. The boss should get knocked on his ass once in a while. It's good for him.
answer: I don't know sir, maybe you should see a doctor.

question: For crying out loud Paul, I'm fine! I'm fine!
Hello? ...Hello?
Yes.
Who is this?
answer: I just wanted you to know that Josh is all right. He's okay.

question: You have my boy?
answer: Yeah. And you're gonna get him back, just the way he was.

question: Look, I swear to God--If you do anything to him, if you touch one hair on his head, I will spend the rest of my life making sure you suffer!
Let me talk to Josh!
answer: Oh, he can't come to the phone right now.

question: Why not? Why not? What did you do to him?!
answer: I didn't do anything to him! I think he's a terrific kid!

question: I want proof that he's all right!
answer: Uh, well, all right. Ask me something that only he would know. Then I'll ask him for you and that way you'll know that he's okay.

question: Ask him what I used to sing to him when he was a little boy.
answer: Isn't there something else that you would rather ask him?

question: Ask him!
answer: Oh, I got it! I got it! Memories, like the corner of my mind. Misty water color memories, of the way we were. Scattered pictures...Look, you're gonna see him again really soon. I promise. I cross my heart. We'll talk about this later.

question: What is this?
$187.00?! Ha! Ha!
answer: Yeah. They really screw you, don't they?

question: Hi.
answer: Hi. Okay, so how would you like that?

question: Three dimes, a hundred dollar bill, and eighty seven ones.
I'm never eating again.
It was the boat ride that did it.
answer: No, it was the pork rinds.

question: Pork rinds! Aghh! We sure had fun, didn't we?
Got you!
Jordan, what's yours?
I'm gonna blow you away Josh!
You work for me, don't you?
I thought so. What, are you here with your kids?
answer: No. I was just looking around.

question: Oh. Me too. I come here every Saturday. Can't see this on a marketing report.
Exactly. Come on. What do you think of that?
answer: The Championship Hockey? Oh, I love it. Only the...

question: Only what?
What do you mean?
answer: Well, on the old set you could slide the men up and down the ice, and now all they do is spin around. It was more like real hockey the old way. Why did they change it?

question: I don't know.
answer: You see, the Star Fighters are good because you can change all the pieces. But I never liked the Galactakons. You only get one robot, and they don't come with a vehicle.

question: I see.
answer: Plus you can't take them underwater. And if you do they...Neat!

question: Okay, let's check out the...Piano lessons?
Me too. Everyday, after school....Chopsticks....What department did you say you were in?
Vice President in charge of Product Development.
answer: Vice President! He's only been here a week! Vice President?!

question: And he came from data processing!
answer: He's out of his mind! The old man has finally lost it!

question: Did you know they gave him Bob's old office?
answer: Bob's office?! Bob's office is bigger than my office! There's got to be a reason. Things like this don't happen unless there's a reason.

question: Come on in.
answer: Look at this place! It's bigger than the principal's office!

question: How would you know?
Oh yes!
You know that only costs 10 bucks to make.
answer: Get out of here! ...What is this?

question: Oh, well, this is just...They just put this in here...it doesn't mean anything.
answer: So what do they make you do for all this?

question: Well, I play with all of this stuff and then, I go in there and tell them what I think.
Yeah.
answer: And they pay you for that?

question: Yeah.
Did you check Mattel?
Colleco?
He can't come from nowhere Susan. He has to come from somewhere. How about Hasbro?
answer: Yes. And Fisher Price and Worlds of Wonder. I have called everywhere. Nobody's ever heard of him!

question: Great!
answer: Face it Paul. The guy comes from data processing.

question: Terrific. That is just terrific! This is just terrific!

These tests were conducted over a six month period using a double-blind format of eight over-lapping demographic groups. Every region of the country was sampled, the focus testing showed a solid base in the 9 to 11-year old bracket--with a possible carry-over into the 12-year olds. When you consider that Nobots and Transformers pull over 37 percent market share, and that we are targeting the same area, I think that we should see one quarter of that and that is one fifth of the total revenue from all of last year. Any questions? Yes? Yes?
What exactly don't you get?
answer: It turns from a building into a robot, right?

question: Precisely.
Well, if you had read your industry breakdown, you would see that our success in the action figure area has climbed from 27 percent to 45 percent in the last two years. There, that might help.
Yes?
Well, there's a million robots that turn into something. And this is a building that turns into a robot. So what's so fun about playing with a building? That's not any fun!
Well, couldn't it be like a robot that turns into something like a bug or something?
Ho! Ho! Ho! He is vicious!
Oh, come on Susan, don't kid yourself. That man is a killer!
answer: All he said was "I don't get it."

question: I don't get it! I don't get! I don't get! He's going for the throat, trying to eviscerate me! Did you see the look on Macmillan's face?!
I'll have another scotch....Susan.
I think it's the same as the maitre's.
answer: Have you decided what you're doing on the Danberry line?

question: No, I haven't.
answer: Well, uh, I think if you got everyone's input up front, I mean right from the beginning....

question: Susan, have a drink.
Excuse me. Hi.
All the same people having all the same discussion. It's like they cloned some party in 1983 and kept spinning it out again and again and again. I loved your ideas on the Squeezy Doll line.
They were so, incisive. It's Beluga. Macmillan orders it every year....You all right? You okay? You want a glass of water? You want something to drink?
answer: Could I have a milkshake or something?

question: I've got a car outside. You want to get out of here?
Let's go. I'm not really a big one for parties. You know, I like things that are a little more intimate.
Well, it's the company's car.
answer: Oh, this is the coolest thing I've ever seen!

question: I mean, just seeing someone in the office, you don't really get a chance to know them. I mean, just being with you here tonight, I really get a sense of who you are.
answer: Are you gonna eat these fries?

question: No. No....
answer: Hey mister? You want some of these fries? We're not going to eat them.

question: You see, it's hard in a business situation...I mean there's this invisible line and even you're attracted to someone...What, are you going to call someone before...?
Uh, I mean at this point in my life I...Don't...Don't play with the radio...Leave the uh...Don't...I'm really vulnerable right now! You know...I mean, I love my job and I....
answer: Ejector seat! This is great! Hey! Come on up! Hey, that was my apartment.

question: Really? I'd love to see where you live. So have you always lived alone?
Ah. Is it just recently or...?
Give yourself a couple of days, it'll pass.
answer: Well, they said it was gonna take six weeks.

question: Well, it can be painful but, that's what they invented Xanax for, right?
I'm not sure we should do this yet.
Well, I mean I like you and I want to spend the night with you....
Well,...yeah!
answer: Okay! But I get to be on top!

question: You live here?
Yeah.
Huh?
Yeah, sure.
answer: They rigged this up so you don't need any quarters....Don't! Don't...!

question: What?
Sorry.
No.
answer: You don't need quarters for this either. It's free.

question: No, thank you.
Is that a trampoline?
No.
answer: You should. It's really fun. It's simple, too. Come on! Come on! You'll like it and it's really easy to do.

question: No, I don't think...
Do have some wine?
answer: Take off your shoes...It's really easy....Let me get rid of these balls.

question: No, I'm...I'm...I'll watch.
answer: Come on. It's fun. I'll do it with you. Up you go. Excellent.

question: Help me up?
Okay.
You want me to jump?
There. Now can we have a drink?
answer: No! No! No! I mean really jump. Now get some air between you and the trampoline.

question: There.
answer: Oh, come on! I'll do it with you! All right? I'll show you how to do it. You ready? Come on. Jump. See? There it is. That's all there is to it. There you go. There you go. Yeah! It's easy! Anybody could do this! Here. Pick one....It's for you. It's a glow in the dark compass ring...so you won't get lost....Goodnight.

question: Did you have fun last night?
Yeah...You left pretty quick.
answer: I gave him a ride home Paul.

question: Oh, did he enjoy it?
Ah, that's me, Mr. Ridiculous. Just a silly old guy.
answer: I don't feel like going out tonight.

question: What do you mean? They're your friends....Come on! Leave it! Leave it! Would you quit it! Do you have to play with everything? Baskin? Baskin!
answer: Wouldn't you rather play basketball? I know how to play that. We could be like a team for the Macmillan Company.

question: No.
answer: I'm not very good at sports, but I'll give it a try. My best sport is video hockey.

question: That isn't a sport.
answer: Well, it takes eye to hand coordination.

question: It's not a sport if you don't sweat!
answer: What about golf? You don't sweat and that's a sport.

question: Yeah, and you're not sittin' there letting some machine do all the work!
Aw shut up Baskin!
I told you. Over the line to serve. Yellow is out of bounds. Play to 21--ready?
One nothing. Come on! Get it! Get it! Get it!
Thatta boy! Okay, you ready? All right....Ho ho! Nice try! That was in! Two zip. Just made it. Two zip. Ready? Okay! Here we go!...19/18.
answer: Uh, that was under the line.

question: What?
answer: That was under the line. You said it had to be over the line on a serve.

question: No I didn't.
answer: Yeah you did! You said it had to be over the line on a serve!

question: No I did not, now give me the goddamn ball!
Give me the goddamn ball, will ya!
Give me the ball you little shit!
Give me the ball! Give me the goddamn ball! I never said that!
Give me the...Give me the ball! Give me the ball!
I did not cheat!
Give me the ball! Give me the ball! Give me it! Give me the ball!
answer: He didn't have to punch me.

question: He didn't have to punch me.
answer: I know. He's scared of you. You don't play his game.

question: I tried to play his game. He beat me up. If he's scared of me then why did he punch me?
answer: He punched you because he's scared of you.

question: I don't get it.
answer: It's just the way he is. Everything is a fight with him. Everyone's an enemy. It's not just a job for him, it's a war.

question: Well how come you're so nice?
Well, you work just as hard as he does and you're not like that.
answer: You don't...you don't know me that well.

question: Yes I do. You're one of the nicest people I've met.
How do you do it?
What does it look like?! Shampoo, razor, toothpaste, two neckties and your exercise tape! Oh, and I want my keys back!
answer: Sure. It's just some scratches. He'll get over it.

question: Oh, it has nothing to do with him.
answer: Oh come on Susan! He's just another link in the chain! First it was Tom Caulfield, then Handlen. Then Golding, then me! Am I missing somebody?

question: It's not like that anymore!
answer: What is so special about Baskin?

question: He's a grown up!
And many more! What are you going to wish for this time? I know what we can do! We can go out and get some beers, some dirty magazines and go back...
What you mean you can't? Of course you can! It's your birthday!
answer: No, I can't...I have to go somewhere.

question: Where?
answer: Um...well, I have to go meet somebody and...

question: So, you got all night!
answer: Yeah I know, but it's just...well I can't right now okay, but I'll call you, all right? Okay? I'll give you a call. Thanks again Billy, it was fun!

question: Yeah I know, but it's just...well I can't right now okay, but I'll call you, all right? Okay? I'll give you a call. Thanks again Billy, it was fun!
answer: Hi....Do you want to come in?

question: Sure.

Yeah! Yeah! Want to go again?! So they have these cars that you can actually drive them except they're on this rail so you can't get off the road...You have a really big gob of mustard right, right...
Mustard right....
Right there.
Well,....
Yeah.
What? Music?
Dance?
answer: Well we don't have to if you don't want to.

question: Okay. Okay.
Okay....Are you cold?
We could get some hot chocolate....You can wear my jacket if you want.
answer: Oh, I haven't done this in a long time....What were you like when you were younger?

question: Oh, I wasn't much different.
answer: I believe that about you....I've been thinking about you a lot....It's crazy....In my car, lying in bed....I've just never gone out with someone like you....With all the other men there was so much to hide....I feel like I can tell you anything.

question: Susan? There's something I think I should tell you.
answer: What? You want the light on?

question: Hey Frank, how are you? Good morning everybody!
I'd like some coffee please Miss Patterson.
And uh, make it black.
answer: You know, you two should come to Vermont. It is so pretty up there.

question: I had no idea he had a fourth ship.
That's right.
answer: He only had that on his second trip, though.

question: You saw it, too.
answer: No, but I used to study...stuff.

question: Really?
All right, but not now Adam.
Algebra? I used to study that, too. All right, let's say Larry Bird is going to score 10 points in the first quarter.
How many is he going to score in the whole game?
Probably. Okay. And that's algebra.
You can do it. I know you can!
answer: I cannot plan a whole line!

question: Why? Nobody knows more about toys in the entire company!
answer: Susan, doing that means marketing and strategy and stuff like that!

question: All he wants is a proposal!
Look, you come up with the ideas and I'll handle the marketing.
Come on. It'll be neat.
answer: All right...I don't know...I don't have any new ideas for toys or anything.

question: You see it won't be like these where you just follow the story along. You would actually make a whole different story appear just by pressing these buttons.
answer: An electronic comic book? That's amazing!

question: Yeah. An electric comic book. It's gonna be different every time.
answer: This is incredible. You're brilliant--you know that?

question: If you like one you could see it, you know, over and over and over again.

You really like it?...You think Mac will like it? You know, what we could do...We could do like sports comics...or like if you're going to steal second or something like that...You'd have sports books...baseball, football...really, it work with almost any sport there is. Hockey!
answer: What...What is it we're doing? ...What's going on here?

question: You know, we're....Is something wrong? You don't like it?
answer: No! No! It's...I mean if it's an affair, that's one thing. But if it's something else...I mean, not that we have to know right now, we don't...but if we think that it could turn into something else...well....How do you feel about all of this?

question: How do I feel about what?
answer: How do you feel about me?

question: Yeah, I have the Keating example right here...
answer: Where've you been? I've been trying to reach you forever!

question: Shh! I'm right in the middle of something okay?
answer: That's the list. All you've got to do is call!

question: Can you give me just a minute, please?
answer: What are you talking about? This is the list!

question: Would you come back at lunch? All right, I'm a little bit busy right now...Hello?
Billy!
answer: Are you out of your mind?!

question: Jesus, Billy! Miss Patterson, could you get them on the phone again....
answer: This is the list we've been waiting for!

question: I've got work to do! Can't you understand that? I've got a deadline to meet. God!
answer: Who the fuck do you think you are?!

question: Hey!
answer: Hey, you're Josh Baskin! Remember? You broke your arm on my roof! You hid in my basement when Robert Diceman was about to rip your head off!

question: You don't get it, do you? This is important!
answer: I'm your best friend. What's more important than that, huh? I'm three months older than you are--asshole!

question: You are standing in the cavern of the evil wizard. All around you are the carcasses of slain ice dwarfs....Melt wizard....What do you want to melt him with? ...Throw thermal pod.
answer: Josh, what's wrong? What is it?

question: I haven't told you something because if I did, I didn't think you'd believe me. And even if you did believe me, I didn't think you were going to like me anymore, so....
answer: Oh, Honey, come here. You can tell me anything. What?

question: Susan, I'm not what you think I am.
Before I met you I was in little league. I was in little league and I rode my bike to school and I played with my friends and hung out with them and....
answer: Josh. Josh. What are you talking about?

question: I want to go home. I miss my family Susan and I want to go home.
No! No!
answer: I knew that this was too good to be true! I knew that there had to be something!

question: No. No. Susan, I'm not married.
No. I'm a child!
I'm a child Susan, and I'm not ready for all this.
answer: Oh that's fine. That is just great!

question: Well, you see what happened....
answer: No. I understand. I'm not ready to make a commitment!

question: No! No! No!
answer: I'm not ready to accept responsibility!

question: No! You don't understand! I mean, I'm thirteen years old!
answer: Oh! And who isn't? You think that there isn't a frightened kid inside of me, too!

question: No! I mean I really am thirteen! I went to bed one night and I was a kid, and when I woke up the next morning I was a grown up.
answer: Oh right! And just yesterday I was a school girl with pigtails! Why are you doing this Josh?

question: There was this carnival in New Jersey. I made a wish on this machine. It was called a Zoltar Machine...

It was called a Zoltar Machine! It had this bobbing head that looked just like a devil and if you got a quarter in the devil's mouth you could make a wish and I did! So I made a wish to be big! That is what I'm trying to tell you! I changed into a grown up but I'm really just a kid!
answer: Fine Josh! You're a kid! Look, I really don't know what it is that you're trying to tell me. But we have a very big presentation to give tomorrow, so I'm going to get some sleep.

question: Josh? Josh! Oh, hi Mrs. Baskin.
answer: Hi. I was just looking around and...Your hair is getting longer.

question: I got it cut yesterday.
Yeah, I know. He'll be coming back real soon. Everything is going to be okay.

There's this flat screen inside with pictures on it and you read it. And when you get down to the bottom you have to make a choice of what the character's going to do...Like if he going to go in and fight the dragon then you have to push one of the buttons.
Paul.
See, there's a computer chip inside which stores the choices, so when you reach the end of the page, you decide where the story goes. That's the point.
A kid makes his own decision.
Sea Point Park? Josh!....Josh! Josh!...Yes!
answer: Excuse me. You know him? You know Josh?

question: Yeah.
answer: Look, you have to tell me where he went.

question: Who are you?
Billy Kopecky.
answer: Look, you have to tell me where he went. Where did he go? Please, tell me. Tell me!

question: Look, you have to tell me where he went. Where did he go? Please, tell me. Tell me!
answer: Work! Damn it!....I wish I was a kid.

question: Josh!
You know, you don't walk out on somebody! You don't just get up and leave and walk out like that! You don't do that!
answer: I know. I know. I'm really sorry. I'm really sorry but I didn't know what to do. I didn't know what to say.

question: Oh God. You got your wish.
I didn't listen, I guess. I didn't hear you...
answer: I tried to tell you last night.

question: ...or want to...or how would I have...or even if I did listen, why would I know? Why would I know that?!
answer: I've been thinking about this and there are a million reasons for me to go home but there is only one reason for me to stay.

question: What? What reason is that?
answer: Well, you...Oh, come on. Don't cry.

question: So, what are you? 15? 16?
Well, that explains it.
answer: Maybe you could come with me.

question: No. No.
I've been there before. It's hard enough the first time. You know what I mean? You don't know what I mean....Come on, I'll drive you home.
No, I'll be okay. You'll be fine. In ten years, who knows? Maybe you should hold on to my number. So this is where you live. Which one is it?
Oh. It's nice. I'm gonna miss you.
You won't even remember me.
answer: Oh yes I will. Mom? Hello!
